title: Investigators in Cheshire hunt shooter who injured Swan
text:
The bird was peppered with shotgun pellets Credit: RSPCA The RSPCA's searching for the shooter who injured a swan so badly it had to be put to sleep.
A passer-by rescued the wounded bird from the Middlewich Canal on Wednesday, and took it to a wildlife centre in Nantwich.
X-ray images show the pellets inside the swan's head Credit: RSPCA X-rays showed four shotgun pellets in the swan's body, alongside an air rifle pellet. The bird was so badly hurt, vets could not save it.
Investigators are appealing to the public for any information on the incident.
It is very distressing to think that people take pleasure in causing harm to these beautiful and defenseless birds. These are deliberate acts of cruelty and we would appeal to people’s consciences not to commit these offences.
– Lee Stewart, RSPCA Last updated Sat 25 Feb 2017
